Develop progressive proficiency in nurse anesthesia practice including basic equipment safety checks, room set up, pre-operative assessment, basic/advanced airway skills, intravenous fluid replacement, positioning of the patient, apply interventions, charting, management of emergence, handoff report, and setting personal daily clinical goals to achieve. 

prereq: N6910; concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in N6901, Grad student in Doctorate of Nursing Practice Program

subject: NURS
name: Anes Care: Cardiothor Prac III
fullname: Nurse Anesthesia Care: Cardiothoracic and Vascular Disease Practicum III
info: Introduction to basic and safe nurse anesthesia care principles and orientation to clinical setting for patients undergoing surgical procedures. prereq: concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 6902, DNP-nurse anesthesia specialty student

subject: NURS
name: AnesCareSpecPopAcrLifespanPrac
fullname: Nurse Anesthesia Care of the Special Population and Across the Lifespan Practicum IV
info:
Develop proficiency in nurse anesthesia practice for special populations, including pediatrics, obstetrics/gynecology, trauma, and patients with acute and chronic pain.

prereq: Grad student in doctorate of nursing practice program nurse anesthesia specialty; concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 6903

subject: NURS
name: Basic Nurs Anes Princ Prac II
fullname: Basic Nurse Anesthesia Principles Practicum II
info:
Develop progressive proficiency in nurse anesthesia practice including basic equipment safety checks, room set up, pre-operative assessment, basic airway skills, intravenous fluid replacement, positioning of patient, management of emergence.

prereq: N6910, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in N6901

subject: NURS
name: Pro Aspects of Nurs AnesthPrac
fullname: Professional Aspects of Nurse Anesthesia Practice
info: The course will explore the history of nurse anesthesia practice and provide an overview of the philosophical and scientific underpinnings of nurse anesthesia practice. Students will evaluate professional licensing, state laws, and credentialing aspects of practice. Nurse anesthesia practice models, delivery systems, and reimbursement will be examined. Students will analyze selected world views and theories from a variety of disciplines with emphasis placed on the development of critical thinking skills within a complex, global, and diverse healthcare environment.

subject: NURS
name: PrimCareAssessHealthCareWellCh
fullname: Primary Care: Assessment of Health and Care of Well Children
info:
Age specific, family-centered, assessment, prevention and health promotion services for infants through adolescents. Comprehensive health supervision. Critical thinking and advanced practice nursing interventions.

prereq: 5200, 5222, 5229, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 6921, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Prim Care Pract: Well Children
fullname: Assessment of Health and Care of Well Children: Primary Care Practicum
info:
Age-specific, family-centered nursing assessment and interventions to promote wellness for infants through adolescence. Compiling and evaluating advanced nursing interventions for disease prevention and health promotion. Models of primary prevention.

prereq: 5200, 5222, 5229, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 6920, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: PrimCareAssesMgeCommCondiChild
fullname: Primary Care: Assessment and Management of Common Conditions Affecting Children
info:
Research-based evaluation and management of common conditions affecting children from infancy through adolescence. Theories and models used to explain and predict physiologic and psychological adaptation of children and their families.

prereq: 6920, 6921, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 6923, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Prim Care Pract: Child Conditn
fullname: Primary Care Practicum: Assessment and Management of Common Conditions Affecting Children
info:
Age-specific, family-centered nursing assessment and intervention of acute and chronic conditions of children within the family context. Nursing intervention strategies including diagnostics, therapeutics, education, and follow-up evaluation of outcomes.

prereq: 6920, 6921, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 6922, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Children Sp Care Needs Interv
fullname: Assessment and Interventions for Children and Youth With Special Health Care Needs
info:
Children and youth with special health care needs. Growth and development, pathophysiology, and specific conditions within a holistic, family-centered, community based, culturally competent, coordinated approach to assessment and intervention.

prereq: instr consent

subject: NURS
name: AdvConceptsReprod&SexHlthCare
fullname: Advanced Concepts in Reproductive and Sexual Health Care
info:
The course builds on foundational theoretical and evidence-based content to develop advanced assessment and care planning competencies throughout the lifespan with a focus on complex gynecological and pregnancy-related conditions.  

prereq: 6305, 6306, 6501

subject: NURS
name: AdvConcepWomensHealthWHNP Pr I
fullname: Advanced Concepts in Women's Health for WHNP Practicum I
info:
Develop advanced women's health assessment/planning skills. Experience working with women who have complex gynecological/pregnancy-related conditions.

prereq: WHNP DNP student, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 6925, 5222, 5228, 5229, 5200, 6305, 6306

subject: NURS
name: Adv Concepts Women's Health II
fullname: Advanced Concepts in Women's Health II
info:
Advanced concepts in gender-specific health care over adult lifespan and common primary health care issues. Utilization of evidence based integrative therapies and inter-professional practice competencies to promote positive outcomes in women's health populations.

prereq: 6305, 6306, 6925, 6926, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 6928, CSPH 5101, current DNP WHNP student

subject: NURS
name: AdvConcWomen'sHealth IIPrac
fullname: Adv Concepts in Women's Health II WHNP Prac
info:
Expands on advanced assessment/management skills in women's health through individualized patient centered care that encompasses primary health issues utilizing integrative approaches/interprofessional practice to promote positive outcomes in women's health populations.

prereq: 6305, 6306, 6925, 6926, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 6927, CSPH 5101, DNP WHNP student

subject: NURS
name: Adv Nurs Pract Acute Ill Child
fullname: Advanced Nursing Care of Children with Acute Illness; Practicum for PCNS
info:
Synthesis and application of theory, research, and evidence-based practice to effectively implement pediatric clinical nurse specialist role. Focuses on comprehensive acute, complex care, role implementation, and contextual factors affecting health of children with special health needs and families.
prereq: [6405, grad student in Nursing admitted to pediatric clinical nurse specialist area] or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Fdn Adv Pub Health Nurs Practi
fullname: Foundations of Advanced Public Health Nursing Practice
info:
Conceptual frameworks for advanced public health nursing practice, trends in population health status. Population-focused nursing evidence. Legal/ethical considerations. Intervention strategies.

prereq: DNP grad student in public health nursing

subject: NURS
name: Health EquityandSocial Justice
fullname: Health Equity and Social Justice
info:
Complex relationships among social determinants of health, health disparities, population health status. Analyze/critique both evidence-based/untested strategies for reducing health disparities.

prereq: 6930 or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Role of Nurs in Environ Health
fullname: The Role of Nursing in Environmental Health
info:
Utilization of environmental health principles for nurses in leadership positions to assess, develop interventions, communicate, and evaluate the effects of environmental hazards on the health of individuals and populations.

prereq: Enrolled in DNP or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: DeterminantsHealthDevCountries
fullname: Determinants of Health in Developing Countries
info:
Health determinants in resource-poor countries are examined from public health nursing and ecological perspectives. Analyze problems, resources, and capacity. Critique existing approaches to development. Develop sensible approaches to complex problems.

prereq: DNP student or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Ppn-focused AssessmentPrioriti
fullname: Population-focused Assessment and Prioritization
info:
Principles of community-based participatory methods used to conduct population-focused assessments. Review literature/identify gaps in knowledge.

prereq: 6930 or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Ppn Focus PubH N Prac PlanDeve
fullname: Population Focused Public Health Nursing Practice: Program Planning and Development
info:
Application of planning models for development of programs to promote and protect the health of populations. Apply concepts to a population health priority in the community clinical setting and integrate evidence based population health strategies into a program plan.

prereq: 6934, 7300

subject: NURS
name: PpnFocusPubHNursPractImpleEval
fullname: Population Focused Public Health Nursing Practice: Program Implementation and Evaluation
info:
Design, implement, and evaluate program plan to promote and protect health of populations. Analyze concepts for a population health priority relevant to the community clinical setting. Develop plan to disseminate results.

prereq: 6930, 6935, 7300, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 6937

subject: NURS
name: PpnFocPHNPractProgImpleEvalPra
fullname: Population Focused Public Health Nursing Practice: Program Implementation Evaluation Practicum
info:
Implement/evaluate programs to promote and protect the health of populations. Students apply concepts to a population health priority in the community clinical setting.

prereq: concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 6936, 6930, 6935, 7300

subject: NURS
name: Emergency PreparePHNursLeaders
fullname: Emergency Preparedness for Public Health Nursing Leaders
info:
Public health nurse leadership functions and national public health nursing competencies in each phase of emergency preparedness plans. Practices stair-step approach to exercise planning when preparing staff to function within National Incident Command infrastructure.

prereq: [concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 6939, DNP student in public health track] or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: PHNEmergencyPrepLeadershipPrac
fullname: Public Health Nursing Emergency Preparedness Leadership Practicum
info:
Program analysis and planning, training for new employees, and evaluation of exercises used to prepare public health agency emergency readiness within a given public jurisdiction.

prereq: concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 6938

subject: NURS
name: HealthEquitySocialJusticePrac
fullname: Health Equity and Social Justice Practicum
info:
Practicum experiences at community site serving populations with compromised health status related to health disparities. Collaborate with agency staff/community partners to identify health disparities relevant to populations served. Develop social justice conceptual framework/propose strategies to improve population health.

prereq: instr consent

subject: NURS
name: PpnfocusedAssessPrioritizaPrac
fullname: Population-focused Assessment & Prioritization Practicum
info:
Population-focused assessment in collaboration with community partners. Identify key informants. Develop community partnerships. Use multiple approaches to data collection/analyses. Prioritize community assets, needs,  contributing factors.

prereq: 6930 or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Advanced Nursing Practice
fullname: Foundations for Advanced Nursing Practice
info: In this foundation course, learners will develop skills and tools to lead a resilient, ethical, and collaborative approach to advanced level nursing practice and sustainably driven quality improvement. This course provides an overview of global systemic and historical factors which have influenced the eco-socio-cultural health of communities and the standards of competence outlined by the AACN Essentials for Advanced Level Nursing Education. In this course, students will develop plans for flourishing at both individual and macro system levels and will explore advocacy, policy, and culturally supportive interventions as it relates to advanced nursing practice.

subject: NURS
name: DNP Post-baccalaureate Sem I
fullname: DNP Postbaccalaureate Seminar I
info: Development/management of the doctor of nursing practice (DNP) leadership project within the context of role transition theory and the health care system and healing environment. Integration of DNP essentials.

subject: NURS
name: Adv Nurse Anes Prac V
fullname: Advanced Nurse Anesthesia Practicum V
info: Develop proficiency in nurse anesthesia practice and progressive independent or minimal supervision anesthesia care including knowledge application of pathophysiology, pharmacology, diagnostics/therapeutic, best practices, and interprofessional collaboration in patients undergoing surgical procedures.

subject: NURS
name: Adv N Anesth Practicum VI
fullname: Advanced Nurse Anesthesia Practicum VI
info:
Develop proficiency in nurse anesthesia practice and independent patient care management for patients undergoing complex and high acuity surgical procedures.

prereq: 7004

subject: NURS
name: Adv Nurse Anes Prac VII
fullname: Advanced Nurse Anesthesia Practicum VII
info:
Develop proficiency in nurse anesthesia practice and management of patient anesthesia care including evaluation of impact of research on clinical practice, achieving a level of safe care in preparation for entry to practice, and demonstration of leadership in the clinical setting with increasing autonomy in decision-making, and case management for various patient populations.

prereq: 7004, 7005

subject: NURS
name: Data Science for Healthcare
fullname: Data Science for Healthcare
info:
This course builds understanding of data science and analytics for use in healthcare, explores concepts of clinical intelligence and the learning health system, and introduces data science methods and analytical skills to evaluate healthcare quality and outcomes.

Course Prerequisites: Strongly recommended graduate level statistical course; Graduate students, and/or instructor consent.

subject: NURS
name: Data Sci Healthcare Practicum
fullname: Data Science for Healthcare Practicum
info:
This course applies knowledge of data science and analytics concepts within the learning health system using selected methods to address gaps in knowledge regarding health care quality or outcome in simulated or real life healthcare data.

Course Prerequisites: Recommend graduate level statistics course

subject: NURS
name: QI and Implementation Science
fullname: Quality Improvement and Implementation Science in Health Care
info: This course focuses on the application of improvement and implementation science to lead quality improvement in healthcare systems. Students will apply the components of a quality improvement plan, using an equity and ethical lens and theory driven strategies to a quality or safety issue in healthcare.

subject: NURS
name: Change Theory &QuaIity Improve
fullname: Integrating Change Theory and Quality Improvement
info:
Analysis and evaluation of change theories in relationship to quality improvement in health care in order to integrate change theory into the design and development of the student's DNP project. 
prereq: 7100 or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Scholrly Dissem Adv Nurs Pract
fullname: Scholarly Dissemination in Advanced Nursing Practice
info: This course focuses on the interpretation, synthesis and scholarly dissemination of the results of nursing scholarship and health systems change initiatives. In this course, students will learn about and practice strategies for effective dissemination of nursing scholarship through writing and presentations in various professional venues as well as a variety of other dissemination strategies.

subject: NURS
name: Nursing Research Methods
fullname: Nursing Research Methods
info: Evaluate research methods underlying development of knowledge for discipline/practice of nursing.

subject: NURS
name: ScholWriting for AdvNursPract
fullname: Scholarly writing for advanced nursing practice
info: This course prepares the advanced nursing practice student to communicate effectively through scholarly writing using essential writing skills and APA style. Topics include finding and appropriately citing scholarly sources of evidence, writing with clarity, applying academic writing style, recognizing and avoiding plagiarism, avoiding bias in writing, and negotiating the ethics of authorship. Students will complete a series of online modules through self-paced learning and submit a writing sample to demonstrate mastery of content.

subject: NURS
name: KnowledgeRepresenInteroperabil
fullname: Knowledge Representation and Interoperability
info:
Conceptual/operational aspects of knowledge representation structures in nursing, including standards and interoperability. Representation of clinical work in the electronic health record. Critical analysis of interoperability, ethical issues, and values.

prereq: NURS 5115 or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: KnowledgeRepresInteroperaPrac
fullname: Knowledge Representation and Interoperability Practicum
info:
Knowledge representation and interoperability principles/standards to improving knowledge in clinical or public health settings. Applied knowledge representation to nursing.

prereq: [NURS 5115 or instr consent], [NURS 7105 or concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in NURS 7105]

subject: NURS
name: Population Health Informatics
fullname: Population Health Informatics
info:
Standards, interoperability, and integration of information systems for population health are examined. Population health use cases are analyzed for potential benefits, legal, ethical, and practical issues related to the development of population health information systems.

prereq: [5115 or [HINF 5430, HINF 5431]] or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Population Health InformatPrac
fullname: Population Health Informatics Practicum
info:
Apply principles, theories, and standards to integration of data to solve a particular population health problem.

prereq: [5115, [[7108 or concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 7108] or [HINF 5430, HINF 5431]]] or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: DNP Project Planning
fullname: DNP Project Planning
info: This course is the first in a series of three in which the student will apply quality improvement techniques, change theory, and interprofessional collaboration through the development of a sustainable evidence-based intervention in the practice arena.

subject: NURS
name: DNP Project Implementation
fullname: DNP Project Implementation
info: This course is the second in a series of three in which the student will apply quality improvement techniques, change theory, and interprofessional collaboration through the implementation of a sustainable evidence-based intervention in the practice arena. This three semester project series provides a foundation for future scholarship and impact for the doctorally-prepared nurse.

subject: NURS
name: DNP Project Eval/Dissemination
fullname: DNP Project Evaluation/Dissemination
info:
This course is the third in a series of three in which the student will apply quality improvement techniques, change theory, and interprofessional collaboration through the implementation of a sustainable evidence-based intervention in the practice arena. This three semester project series provides a foundation for future scholarship and impact for the doctorally-prepared nurse.

prereq: NURS 7110 and NURS 7111 (may be concurrent with instructor permission)

subject: NURS
name: Clin Decision Support:: Theory
fullname: Clinical Decision Support: Theory
info:
Principles and concepts of knowledge management and decision making for support of clinical practice. Students design a clinical decision support intervention and examine the legal, ethical, and practical issues related to its implementation and maintenance of CDS interventions.

prereq: 5115 or HINF 5430/5431 or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Clinical Decision Support Prac
fullname: Clinical Decision Support Practicum
info:
Apply clinical decision support knowledge to the development and application of a clinical decision support intervention.

prereq: [5115, [[7113 or concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 7113] or [HINF 5430, HINF 5431]]] or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: HumanFacComputerInteracHlthInf
fullname: Human Factors and Human-Computer Interaction in Health Informatics
info:
Principles of human factors and human-computer interaction to optimize research/practice in nursing and health informatics. Interactive system design that accommodates/enhances capabilities of user.

prereq: Biostatistics or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Economics of Health Care
fullname: Economics of Health Care
info:
Economic theories of health care in relation to health disparities and global health. Financing strategies, payment systems, and their effect on doctor/nursing practice.

prereq: Admission to DNP program

subject: NURS
name: Nurs Moral/Ethical Pos/Action
fullname: Moral and Ethical Positions and Actions in Nursing
info: Normative ethics and theoretical underpinnings for positions taken. Implications for subsequent action. Morally defensible positions on health-related issues, corresponding actions from perspective of nursing.

subject: NURS
name: HealthEconFinan in AdvNursPrac
fullname: Healthcare Economics and Finance in Advanced Nursing Practice
info: By the conclusion of this course, advanced nursing practice students are prepared to apply economic and finance concepts in a variety of practice settings. The student will translate practice-relevant concepts and priorities (e.g. technology, evidenced-based practice, return on investment) into actions that are valued by organizational decision-makers, leveraging advocacy techniques, advanced decision-making, and evidence-based data with an emphasis on conceptualizing resources broadly. Additionally, the student will utilize evidence-based, innovative leadership and advocacy principles in the development of economic and business models to promote equitable distribution of healthcare resources, address health disparities, and improve population health.

subject: NURS
name: Integrative Nursing I
fullname: Integrative Nursing I
info:
This is a foundational course for advanced nursing practice with a focus on the scholarship, research, and theory underlying integrative nursing. 

prereq: NURS 5101, NURS 5200, NURS 5222, NURS 7000, taken concurrent with CSpH 5226

subject: NURS
name: Integrative Nursng Practicum I
fullname: Integrative Nursing Practicum I
info:
This is a foundation clinical course in advanced integrative nursing practice with a focus on integrative nursing assessment, management, and evaluation. 

prereqs: N5101, N5200, N5222, N7000, CSpH 5535, CSpH 5806, CSpH 5631, CSpH 5313, CSpH 5503, concurrent with N7209

subject: NURS
name: Integrative Nursng Didactic II
fullname: Integrative Nursing Didactic II
info:
This is a foundational course for advanced integrative nursing practice with a focus on the scholarship, research, and theory underlying integrative therapies and integrative models of care within the context of health promotion, disease prevention, health care provider wellbeing and resilience, interprofessional collaboration, and education. 

prereqs: N5101, N5200, N5222, N5701, N6200, N7000, N7209, N7210, N7900, CSpH 5421, CSpH 5713, CSpH 5431, CSpH 5226, CSPH 5706

subject: NURS
name: Integrative Nurs Practicum II
fullname: Integrative Nursing Practicum II
info:
This is a foundational course for advanced integrative nursing practice with a focus on the development of clinical competencies in community needs assessment, healthcare provider wellbeing, teaching and learning, and interprofessional collaboration. 

prereq: N5101, N5200, N5222, N5701, N6200, N7000, N7209, N7210, N7900, N7211 (or concurrent enrollment), CSpH 5535, CSpH 5806, CSpH 5631, CSpH 5313, CSpH 5503, CSpH 5421, CSpH 5713, CSpH 5431, CSpH 5226, CSPH 5706

subject: NURS
name: Midwife Clin Prof Integration
fullname: Midwifery Clinical and Professional Integration
info:
Integration of the clinical role of the nurse-midwife, including understanding of the role of the midwife in leadership, legislation, and policy.

prereq: Nurse midwifery DNP student in final semester, no incomplete cr, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Integrative Health Healing III
fullname: Integrative Health and Healing III
info:
Programs of integrative therapies and healing practices in a variety of clinical/organizational settings. Creation of holistic nursing health care models, sustainable business plans, and the application of leadership skills.

prereq: 7211 or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: IntegrativeHealthHealngIIIPrac
fullname: Integrative Health and Healing Practicum III
info:
Application of leadership competencies in developing, implementing, and evaluating integrative health and healing services and programs.

prereq: 7212 or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: AdvNurs Pub, Pop, Planet Healt
fullname: Advanced Nursing for Public, Population, and Planetary Health
info: The course is designed to address healthcare delivery and outcomes from public health prevention to disease management of populations to transdisciplinary solutions for planetary health. The course provides foundational principles to examine health equity from patient to planet. Students will advance key advanced nursing skill sets in relation to advocacy, multi-sectoral partnership, epidemiology, health equity, and preparedness that will serve as tools in diverse scholarly, clinical, and programmatic practice contexts.

subject: NURS
name: Program Planning and Eval
fullname: Program Planning and Evaluation
info:
A critical analysis of methods for practical program planning and evaluation for advanced nursing professionals in leadership roles; includes evaluation of approach and design, intervention processes including stakeholder issues, measurement issues, and strategies to evaluate outcomes achievement.

prereq: Admission to DNP program or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: WHNP Clinical Prof Integration
fullname: WHNP Clinical and Professional Integration
info:
Integration of the clinical and professional role of the women's health nurse practitioner, including understanding of the role of the WHNP in leadership, legislation, and policy.

prereq: WHNP DNP student in final semester, passed all courses, no incomplete credits

subject: NURS
name: PNP-AC Skills Practicum
fullname: Pediatric Nurse Practitioner - Acute Care Skills Practicum
info: This course provides the student with exposure to advanced skills commonly performed in pediatric acute care settings. The student will apply this knowledge as they formulate and implement individualized patient-centered health care management plans to support positive health outcomes in acute care settings.

subject: NURS
name: PNP- Acute Care I
fullname: Pediatric Nurse Practitioner Acute Care I
info: The first of two theoretical courses focusing on the principles of diagnostic evaluation and treatment of acutely and chronically ill and injured pediatric patients.  Synthesis and application of nursing theory, research, and evidence-based practice standards in the evaluation and implementation of safe and effective interventions in care and treatment of acutely and chronically ill and injured pediatric patients.

subject: NURS
name: PNP-AC Practicum I
fullname: Pediatric Nurse Practitioner Acute Care Practicum I
info: In this practicum, the student will have practical application of the PNP-AC role in a variety of acute care clinical settings. Emphasis will be on nursing intervention strategies including diagnostics, therapeutics, education, and follow-up of clinical outcomes.

subject: NURS
name: PNP- Acute Care II
fullname: Pediatric Nurse Practitioner Acute Care II
info: The second of two theoretical courses focusing on the principles of diagnostic evaluation and treatment of acutely and critically ill pediatric patients within the context of their families. Emphasis on research-based evaluation and management of the acutely and critically ill pediatric patient.

subject: NURS
name: PNP-AC Practicum II
fullname: Pediatric Nurse Practitioner Acute Care Practicum II
info: The final practicum course in the Pediatric Nurse Practitioner Acute Care Post Graduate Certificate program. The student will have practical application of the PNP-AC role in a variety of acute care clinical settings with an emphasis on critically ill patients.

subject: NURS
name: Health Policy Leadership
fullname: Health Policy Leadership
info:
Acquisition of policy leadership and advocacy principles and skills and engagement in the process of organizational and governmental health policy development to transform health care delivery, promote equitable distribution of health care resources, address health disparities, and improve population health.

prereq: Admission to DNP program

subject: NURS
name: Health Policy Leadership Prac
fullname: Health Policy Leadership Practicum
info: Translation of nursing, health, and political science and application of health policy advocacy knowledge and skills to improve health care delivery, address health disparities, or advance population health.

subject: NURS
name: Adv Nurs Prac Adult-Gero Healt
fullname: Advanced Nursing Practicum in Adult-Gerontology Health
info:
Final clinical course developing proficiency in the advanced practice specialty role. Focus is on applying/evaluating evidence for clinical practice and achieving a level of competency as a clinical nurse specialist or nurse practitioner in adult-gerontology health.

prereq: [5222, 5228, 5224, 5200, 6407, 6501, 7505, not [ANP or GNP]] or [5222, 5228, 5224, 5200, 6407, 6500, 6501, 7504, 7505, [ANP or GNP]] or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: AGACNP Interv & Procdurs Pract
fullname: Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner Specialty Interventions and Procedures Practicum
info: This course provides the student with exposure to advanced interventions and procedures commonly performed in adult acute care settings. The student will apply this knowledge as they formulate and implement person-centered health care management plans to support safe and effective health outcomes in acute care settings.

subject: NURS
name: Adult-Gero Acute Care NP I
fullname: Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner I
info: The first of two theoretical courses focusing on the principles of diagnostic evaluation and patient-centered treatment of acute and chronically ill adults and older-adults. Synthesis and application of nursing and medical theory, research and evidence-based practice standards in the evaluation and implementation of safe and effective interventions in the care and treatment of acutely and chronically ill adults and older-adults.

subject: NURS
name: AGACNP Practicum I
fullname: Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner Practicum I
info: In this practicum, the student will have practical application of the Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner role in a variety of acute care clinical settings. Emphasis will be on nursing intervention strategies including patient evaluation, diagnostics, therapeutics, education, and follow-up of clinical outcomes for adult and older-adult patients with acute conditions which do not require intensive or critical care interventions.

subject: NURS
name: Adult-Gero Acute Care NP II
fullname: Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner II
info: The second of two theoretical courses focusing on the principles of diagnostic evaluation and treatment of acutely  and chronically ill adults and older-adults with an emphasis on complex, high acuity conditions, requiring interventions in the intensive or critical care settings.  Synthesis and application of nursing and medical theory, research, and evidence-based practice standards in the evaluation and implementation of safe and effective interventions in care and treatment of complex acutely and chronically ill adults and older-adults. Advanced practice nurse application of interprofessional collaborative practices, ethical principles, contemporary practice changes, health policy, safety, and implementation of quality driven initiatives pertaining to the care of complex acutely ill adults and older-adults in the acute and critical care setting.

subject: NURS
name: AGACNP Practicum II
fullname: Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner Practicum II
info: In this practicum, the student will demonstrate practical application of the AGACNP role in a high-acuity or critical care clinical setting. Emphasis will be on nursing intervention strategies including evaluation, diagnostics, therapeutics, education, and follow-up of clinical outcomes for adults and older-adults building on the concepts learned in the first practicum but with a deliberate focus on complex, high acuity conditions which require interventions in the intensive, emergent, or critical care settings.

subject: NURS
name: HealthCareChildrenforFamilyNP
fullname: Health Care of Children for the Family Nurse Practitioner
info:
Application of mid-range theories, models, concepts, and research in designing age-specific plans for the promotion, maintenance, and restoration of the health of infants, children, and adolescents within the context of their families and communities.

prereq: 5200, 7503, 7504, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 6102, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 7501, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 7506, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: HealthCareChildFNPractitioPrac
fullname: Health Care of Children for the Family Nurse Practitioner Practicum
info:
Nursing theory, research, and evidence-based practice standards in evaluating/implementing safe and effective interventions to promote health and prevent illness in infants, children, and adolescents. Evaluation of evidence-based outcomes.

prereq: 5200, 5222, 5228, 5229, 6501, 7504, 7505, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: HealthCareOlderAdultsforAGNP
fullname: Health Care of Older Adults for Adult-Gerontology Nurse Practitioner: Acute and Chronic Management
info: Geriatric clinical management, diagnostic criteria, and evidence-based treatment approach for acute and chronic medical conditions in outpatient environments, including complex sub-acute care. Clinical evidence, research, and models of care to optimize and restore the health of older adults are emphasized.

subject: NURS
name: ReprodHealthCareWomenPractFNP
fullname: Reproductive Health Care of Women Practicum for Family Nurse Practitioners
info:
Application of holistic health histories and physical assessments of women. Synthesize/use knowledge and research in clinical decision making to formulate health care management plans related to women's reproductive and sexual health throughout the life cycle.

prereq: 5200

subject: NURS
name: AssesMgmtHealthAPNPrac I
fullname: Assessment and Management of Health for Advanced Practice Nurses, Practicum I
info:
Application of holistic health histories and physical assessments by advanced practice nurses to formulate and implement individualized patient-centered health care management plans to support positive health outcomes in primary care populations experiencing acute and stable chronic conditions.

prereq: 5200, 5222, 5224, 5229, 6501

subject: NURS
name: AssessMgmtHealthAPNPracII
fullname: Assessment and Management of Health for Advanced Practice Nurses Practicum II
info:
Comprehensive advanced nursing assessment/management for acute and chronic health conditions of the primary care population across the life span. Synthesis/application of nursing theory and evidence-based implementation/evaluation of safe and effective therapeutic interventions to promote, maintain, and restore health.

prereq: 5200, 5222, 5224, 5229, (6501 or concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 6501), (6502 or concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 6502)

subject: NURS
name: NursFNPFamilyPractice Prac III
fullname: Family Practice Practicum III: Assessment and Management of Health for the Family Nurse Practitioner
info:
Evaluation of theories and research to support the development of holistic nursing practice models and clinical decision-making for health promotion, disease prevention and intervention. Evaluation of patient outcomes using nursing standards and criteria.

prereq: 5200, 5222, 5228, 5229, 6501, 7504, 7505, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: AssesMgmtHlthPracIVHlthLead
fullname: Assessment and Management of Health Practicum IV:Health Leadership for Family Nurse Prac
info:
Integration of the essentials of doctoral education into the FNP clinical role. Students analyze individual level and community/systems factors and public policies to demonstrate leadership capabilities in creating holistic, multi-system, interprofessional collaborative approaches to address health concerns and health disparities. 

prereq: 7400 or concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 7400, 7506

subject: NURS
name: Hlth Care Elder for FNP pract
fullname: Health Care of the Elderly for the Family Nurse Practitioner Practicum
info:
Synthesis and application of nursing theory, research and evidence-based practice standards in the evaluation and implementation of safe, effective interventions to promote health and prevent illness in elder patients from family- and patient-centered contexts. Evaluation of  evidence-based outcomes.

prereq: 7504, 7505

subject: NURS
name: Nurs Fam Prac Prac VI FNP
fullname: Assessment and Management of Health Practicum VI: Primary Care for the Family Nurse Practitioner
info:
Managing health across the lifespan in primary care settings. Health promotion, disease prevention, intervention. Implementing holistic, culturally-sensitive comprehensive, collaborative nursing practice models. Theories, ethical principles, research.

prereq: 5200, 5222, 5228, 5229, 6501, 7504, 7505, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 7507, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 7508

subject: NURS
name: HealthCareChildforFNPWellChild
fullname: Health Care of Children for the Family Nurse Practitioner: Well Child Care
info:
Development of knowledge of mid-range theories, care models. Promotion/maintenance of health of newborns, infants, children, adolescents within context of families/communities.

prereq: Admitted FNP DNP student

subject: NURS
name: HealthCareChildFNPAcuteChronic
fullname: Health Care of Children for the Family Nurse Practitioner: Acute and Chronic Management
info:
Identifying diagnostic criteria for common acute/chronic pediatric conditions. Apply mid-range theories, research, models of care to restore health of newborns, infants, children, adolescents.

prereq: 5200, 7515, 7504, 7505

subject: NURS
name: Health Care Elder Pt for FNP
fullname: Health Care of the Elder Patient for the Family Nurse Practitioner
info:
The application of mid-range theories, models, and concepts applicable to the promotion, maintenance, and restoration of the health elderly patients within the context of their families and communities. Current research is evaluated and used as the basis for designing age-specific interventions for elderly patients and their families.

prereq: Nurs 6502

subject: NURS
name: Eval Evid to Improve Nurs Prac
fullname: Evaluating Evidence to Improve Nursing Practice
info:
Application, synthesis, and critical evaluation of health related evidence and examination of ethical considerations. It focuses on critiquing research studies, clinical practice guidelines, systematic and integrative literature reviews, and synthesizing a body of evidence to support evidence based practice, health care quality, and health equity. 

prereq: [Statistics, pre-req or concurrent]

subject: NURS
name: Psych Intervent w IndivGrpsFam
fullname: Psychotherapeutic Interventions With Individuals, Families and Groups
info: Analyze theory and research as a basis for integrating psychotherapy for individuals, families, and groups across the lifespan and continuum of healthcare systems.

subject: NURS
name: PsychMH AdvNursPracticum IV
fullname: Psychiatric/Mental Health Advanced Practice Nursing Practicum IV
info: Clinical focus: Apply theories, research and clinical evidence about psychotherapeutic interventions and therapeutic use of self to promote mental health management, and recovery from biopsychosocial sequelae of psychiatric illnesses experienced by individuals of all ages and families.

subject: NURS
name: Exec Sem: Bound Spanning Ldshp
fullname: Executive Leadership Seminar: Boundary Spanning Leadership
info:
Boundary spanning leadership for solving problems, driving innovation, and transforming healthcare organizations to advance the common good and improve health care by employing strategies that engage people from outside the organization in collaborative teams.

prereq: [6705, 6706] or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Exec Prac: Boundary Span Ldshp
fullname: Executive Leadership Practicum: Boundary Spanning Leadership
info:
Apply boundary spanning leadership in comparison to other leadership theories for solving problems, driving innovation, and transforming healthcare organizations to a specific healthcare setting/organization by implementing strategies that engage people from outside the organization in collaborative teams.

prereq: [6704, 6706] or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: RelationshipBasedLeadershiMgmt
fullname: Relationship-Based Leadership and Management
info:
Concepts, theories, and practices that support relationship-based leadership and management. Framework/set of tools to provide leadership in an empowered organization.

prereq: Grad student or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: HealthCareFinanceResourceMgmt
fullname: Health Care Finance and Resource Management
info:
Financial planning, budgeting, reimbursement and decision-making concepts and strategies are applied to health care and service organizations. Emphasis is on conceptualizing resources broadly, particularly nursing, and translating practice relevant concepts and priorities into actions valued by organizational decision makers.

prereq: Grad student or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Nurses Lead Change & Innovatn
fullname: Nurses Leading Change and Innovation to Transform Healthcare
info: This course will prepare doctoral nursing students for advanced nursing practice to integrate whole systems thinking, contemporary theories, and factors contributing to effective leadership in multi-sectoral settings. The focus includes: team dynamics, partnership in practice, innovation, inclusivity, health equity, and wellbeing. The vision is to prepare nursing leaders to transform healthcare for improvement of health for all people.

subject: NURS
name: Psych MHAPN Prof Seminar
fullname: Psychiatric/Mental Health Advanced Practice Nursing: Professional Seminar
info:
Psychiatric/mental health advanced practice nursing: professional seminar.

prereq: 6802, 6803

subject: NURS
name: Psych MHAPN Practicum V
fullname: Psychiatric/Mental Health Advanced Practice Nursing: Practicum V
info:
Final course provides opportunities for refinement of PMH APN roles and integration of DNP activities into clinical experiences. Providing evidence-based nursing care to persons experiencing or at risk of experiencing psychiatric disorders to positively influence health care delivery.

prereq: [6802, 6803] or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: AdvNurs Leader GlobaImpactPrac
fullname: Advanced Nursing Leadership for Global Impact Practicum
info: This practicum course allows students to demonstrate knowledge from the didactic course, Advanced Nursing Leadership for Global Impact, into practice. Students may select one of two practice settings, an immersion experience in New York City or an immersion experience in a local setting. By the conclusion of course, students will demonstrate leadership competencies related to global health and advancement of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

subject: NURS
name: AdultandGeroCNSinAcuteCare
fullname: The Adult and Gerontological Clinical Nurse Specialist in Acute Care
info:
Development of advanced clinical reasoning, assessment of clinical outcomes, quality improvement and research based care for adult and elder patients with acute illness. Use of theory and research in the role of the CNS.

prereq: 5200, 5222, 5224, 5228, 6100, 6405, 7103, 7900

subject: NURS
name: Impl Role of CNS: Acute Care
fullname: Implementing the Role of the Clinical Nurse Specialist in Acute Care
info:
Development of clinical expertise of CNS in provision of advanced nursing care for adults/elders. Students will utilize theory/research to implement roles of CNS.

prereq: N5222, N5228, N5224, N7103, N5200, N7900, N6100, 7705 (co-requisite)

subject: NURS
name: Nurs Professional Active Statu
fullname: School of Nursing Professional Active Status
info:
Limited to two enrollments during school career.

prereq: instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Adv Tpcs Professional Nursing
fullname: Advanced Topics in Professional Nursing
info:
Methods, theory, or advanced topics, including supervised projects.

prereq: instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Schol Teach/Learn in Nursing
fullname: Scholarly Teaching and Learning in Nursing
info: Critical analysis of teaching-learning theories and evidence about elements that comprise effective teaching in diverse populations in order to design and evaluate the quality of plans for educational experiences that facilitate achievement of desired learner outcomes in nursing.

subject: NURS
name: Adv Schol Teach/Learn Nursing
fullname: Advanced Scholarly Teaching and Learning in Nursing
info: Exploration of teaching-learning theory and evidence as applied to the design, development, implementation, and evaluation of effective teaching in a variety of settings.

subject: NURS
name: Nursing Education Practicum
fullname: Nursing Education Practicum
info:
Design, implementation, and evaluation of evidence-based, scholarly teaching and learning in various nursing education contexts. Analysis of select nursing program in relation to meeting standards for accreditation and various other expected outcomes of nursing programs. 

prereq: Graduate student in nursing or Nurs 7900 or equivalent.

subject: NURS
name: Adv Pract Complx Ped Practicum
fullname: Advanced Practice Care and Leadership in Health Systems for Complex Pediatric Practice Practicum
info: Clinical practicum focused on system-based application of advanced pediatric concepts in the care of children and families to support transition to advanced practice roles.  Emphasis is on clinical reasoning, interprofessional collaboration, leadership, and family partnership to support care for children across systems and within communities.

subject: NURS
name: Adv Practice Complex Pediatric
fullname: Advanced practice care and leadership in health systems for complex pediatric practice
info: Seminar focused on system-based application of primary care and specialty care concepts  in the care of children and families to support transition to advanced practice roles. Emphasis is on clinical reasoning, interprofessional collaboration, leadership, and family partnership to support care for children across systems and within communities.

subject: NURS
name: Adv Interv Fam, Sp Care Child
fullname: Adv Assessment, Intervention in Families of Children and Youth With Special Health Care Needs Prac
info:
Assess, intervene, and evaluate intervention models related to patterns of functioning in families of children with complex health care needs. Prepares nurses to become members of an interdisciplinary team, working with families with special health care needs from diverse cultural backgrounds.

prereq: [6102 or equiv family theory course, 6200, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 7925, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 7926] or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: PublicHealthNursLeadershipPrac
fullname: Public Health Nursing Leadership Practicum
info:
Synthesis of advanced public health nursing research. Theory/application to health policy leadership, management, administration within public health nursing leadership situations.

prereq: 6930

subject: NURS
name: PublicHealthNursLeadershipRole
fullname: Public Health Nurse Leadership Role
info:
Analyzes issues challenging advanced practice public health nursing including policy/practice issues. Relationships with stakeholders/constituencies involved with public health issues. Public sector financing.

prereq: [6930, DNP student] or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: ApplBehavChangeTheoryPpnHealth
fullname: Application of Behavior Change Theory to Population Health
info:
Review of selected theories of health behavior change for individuals, groups, organizations, communities, systems. Synthesize/apply theories appropriately/effectively to guide public health nursing practice.

prereq: 6930, [PubH 6020 or instr consent]

subject: NURS
name: ApplBehavChngeThryPpnHealthPra
fullname: Application of Behavior Change Theory to Population Health Practicum
info:
Clinical application/synthesis of selected theories of health behavior change for individuals, groups, organizations, communities, systems in population-based setting.

prereq: 6930, PubH 6020

subject: NURS
name: Discipline of Nurs
fullname: The Discipline of Nursing
info:
Knowledge structures used in nursing; theories, models, and conceptual frameworks. Articulation and evaluation of personal conceptual framework for advanced nursing practice.

prereq: Grad nurs major or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Dev Nrsg Knowledge
fullname: Developing Nursing Knowledge
info: Philosophical perspectives, research methodologies for developing nursing knowledge.

subject: NURS
name: Found of Disc
fullname: Theoretical Foundations of the Discipline
info:
Paradigms in nursing and related methods of inquiry, knowledge structures, and projection of needs for further knowledge development and testing.

prereq: 8100 or equiv, knowledge of phil of sci

subject: NURS
name: Theory Devel
fullname: Theory Development in Nursing
info:
Strategies for theory development; synthesis of theoretical formulations in nursing using selected inductive and deductive theory development strategies.

prereq: 8100 or equiv, 8112 or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Integrated Sem Nurs Informatic
fullname: Integrated Seminar in Nursing Informatics
info:
Problem-focused topics related to nursing and health informatics theory, measurement, and ethical/policy issues.  Interdisciplinary, cross-institutional relationships. Interpersonal dynamics that support trust-building exchanges.

prereq: Doctoral student, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Clin Decis Support:Theory, App
fullname: Clinical Decision Support: Theory and Application
info:
Principles/concepts of knowledge management and decision making. Students design a clinical decision support intervention. Legal, ethical, and practical issues related to its implementation and maintenance of CDS interventions.

prereq: 5115 or [HINF 5430, HINF 5431] or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Phenom of Health
fullname: Phenomenon of Health
info: Prevailing and emerging views of health from differing belief systems and methods of inquiry. Philosophical, theoretical, and methodological implications for development of a nursing paradigm based on evolving perspectives of humanness.

subject: NURS
name: Hlth Behaviors Illness Resp
fullname: Health Behaviors and Illness Responses
info:
Theories of health behaviors and responses to illness are analyzed/critiqued.  Multivariate research designs. Specification of testable, descriptive, dynamic models for health/illness that incorporate culture, biology, environment, and health systems for diverse individuals, families, communities, and populations.

prereq: Doctoral student or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Stress,Coping,Hlth
fullname: Stress, Coping, and Health
info: Stress and coping theories and related research; adequacy and efficacy of stress-management interventions/programs; directions for future research.

subject: NURS
name: Comp Ther
fullname: Complementary Therapies: Theory and Research
info: Scientific basis of selected complementary therapies such as therapeutic touch, imagery, music, and massage; hypotheses related to selected interventions; appropriate methodologies.

subject: NURS
name: Family Hlth Theory
fullname: Family Health Theory
info:
Emerging theory in family nursing science. Related theories. Research on family systems for structuring a systemic framework to examine clinical problems related to family health care. Applications to selected phenomena of interest to health care.

prereq: 8100 or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Theory in Nursing Research
fullname: Theory in Nursing Research
info: Analysis of current philosophical and theoretical perspectives in nursing science. Evaluation of theories and conceptual models and their application in nursing research.

subject: NURS
name: Qual Rsrch for Nurs & Hlth Car
fullname: Qualitative Research for Nursing and Health Care
info:
Analysis of key qualitative research methods and corresponding analysis strategies. Focus is on developing understanding of rigorous qualitative methods that contribute to nursing and health science knowledge generation.

prereq: NURS 8131

subject: NURS
name: Interventions&Outcomes Researc
fullname: Interventions and Outcomes Research
info:
Design/evaluation of intervention/outcomes research. Use of advanced experimental design and multivariate statistical approaches to evaluate theory-based interventions with longitudinal outcomes in context.

prereq: 8121, PhD student, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Moral/Ethical
fullname: Moral and Ethical Positions in Nursing
info:
Synthesis of ethical positions, from nursing perspective, on health-related issues at individual, group, population, and policy levels. Normative ethics, theoretical basis for positions taken, and contextual implications for subsequent action.

prereq: Grad nurs major or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Des Quant & Interv Nurs Resrch
fullname: Designing Quantitative and Intervention Nursing Research
info:
Designs for quantitative and intervention research will be analyzed and applied to investigating nursing topics. Emphasis is on evaluation of the appropriateness of designs in relation to nursing research questions and strengths and limitations of the designs.

prereq: NURS 8131 (pre or concurrent) or instructor approval

subject: NURS
name: Quant Data Collect Mthd & Meas
fullname: Quantitative Data Collection Methods and Measurement for Nursing Research
info: Principles of data collection and measurement appropriate for use in quantitative nursing research investigations will be examined. Different types of data collection methods, measurement designs and methods, their strengths and limitations, and application in nursing research studies will be analyzed.

subject: NURS
name: Eth Dev Nurs Sc
fullname: Moral and Ethical Development in Nursing Science
info: Interactions among research and theory in moral judgment and behavior, applied ethics, and nursing.

subject: NURS
name: Adv Ethics in Nurs Res and Sch
fullname: Advanced Ethics in Nursing Research and Scholarship
info:
Students will analyze values underlying concepts and discourses of health, disease, risk, and use of health care technologies. They will analyze central ethical issues in nursing research, scholarship, and research integrity as part of ethics training required to conduct research. 

prereq: Nursing PhD student or permission of faculty

subject: NURS
name: Dev Resch Propls in Nurs or HS
fullname: Developing Research Proposals in Nursing or Health Sciences
info:
This course integrates scientific and practical aspects of conducting research and encourages students to think through study design, sample selection, measures and data collection, analysis plans, and study conduct. The primary goal is to develop grant writing skills for extramural/intramural nursing or health-related research grants.

prereq: NURS 8141, NURS 8132, 8142 (prereq or concurrent)

subject: NURS
name: Res in Nurs
fullname: Research in Nursing
info:
Research process/methods appropriate for problems relevant to nursing. Critique of research studies, proposal development.

prereq: concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in  8170 or inferential stat course taken within two yrs

subject: NURS
name: Qualitative Res Design Methods
fullname: Qualitative Research Design and Methods
info:
Overview and comparative analysis of selected qualitative research methods and analytic strategies. Focuses on developing rigorous qualitative designs that contribute to development of nursing and health care knowledge for diverse populations.

prereq: 8170 or equiv

subject: NURS
name: Theory and Theory Dev Research
fullname: Theory and Theory Development for Research
info:
Paradigms in nursing/health, associated methods of scientific/scholarly inquiry. Inductive/deductive techniques for theory development  Theory-testing using data obtained under controlled conditions.

prereq: Doctoral student

subject: NURS
name: Implementing Res
fullname: Principles and Methods of Implementing Research
info:
Integrates scientific, statistical, and practical aspects of research. Inter-relationships among design, sample selections, subject access, human subjects requirements, instrument selection and evaluation, data management, analyses plans, grant writing, and research career issues. Field experiences required.

prereq: 8114 or other 8xxx grad research methods course, 2 grad stat courses;

subject: NURS
name: Quantitative Res Design Method
fullname: Quantitative Research Design and Methods
info:
Designs for quantitative description and quasi-experimental/experimental evaluation of scientific problems across domain of nursing. Evaluation of logic of design/attribution of causality from health and social science perspectives.

prereq: [PhD student in nursing, advanced applied statistics] or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Decision Making
fullname: Research on Decision Making in Health Care
info:
Conceptual models/studies on decision making about health care. Formulating research proposals to investigate health care decisions by health care professionals, health care policy makers, patients/clients, or families.

prereq: One graduate-level research course, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Adv Nsg Research Practicum
fullname: Advanced Nursing Research Practicum
info:
NURS 8177 Advanced Nursing Research Practicum is a required independent study course where students participate in designing or conducting a nursing or health-related research study under the supervision of a School of Nursing faculty investigator. 

prereq: PhD nursing student, instr consent, adviser consent

subject: NURS
name: Fam Hlth Phen
fullname: Methods for the Study of Family Health Phenomena
info:
Conceptual and methodological approaches in study of family health phenomena from nursing perspective. Research designs formulated to study questions in this area.

prereq: 8124, 8100 or equiv or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Biophys Measu Instru Clin Rese
fullname: Biophysiological Measurement and Instrumentation in Clinical Research
info:
Critical issues in measurement and instrumentation for clinical research. Methodological issues and critical appraisal of instruments in the study of biophysiological phenomena. Field observation experiences.

prereq: [8173, 8175 or equiv, advanced level stat or concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in advanced level stat] or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Doc Prosem I:Scholarly Develop
fullname: Doctoral Proseminar I: Scholarly Development
info:
Transition to doctoral study. Begins socialization process to role of nursing scholar/scientist. Career trajectories of nursing scholars who have pursued various roles.

prereq: Doctoral nursing student

subject: NURS
name: Protection of Research Subject
fullname: Protection of Research Subjects
info: Ethical research conduct from design to dissemination. Application of Code of Federal Regulations for protecting human subjects, role of and relationship with Institutional Review Boards, risk management. Safety monitoring and reporting of adverse events. Data management. Misconduct policies.

subject: NURS
name: Policy Implications Nurs Resea
fullname: Policy Implications of Nursing Research
info:
Nursing research as a foundation for health policy.  Research utilization for resolution of global, national, and state policy issues affecting population health and health service delivery. Political analysis to effect policy change.

prereq: Nursing doctoral student or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Qual Data Analy Hlth Care Rese
fullname: Qualitative Data Analysis for Health Care Research
info:
Qualitative analysis techniques for descriptive, interpretive, and analytic data including data preparation, management and analysis are presented. Transforming data from multiple texts to theoretical conceptualizations, writing skills and dissemination of qualitative research findings suitable to each method are stressed.

prereq: 8171 or grad course in qualitative research methods

subject: NURS
name: Crit Review Nur & Hlth Res
fullname: Critical Review in Nursing and Health Research
info:
Skills needed to critique a body of scientific literature in focused areas of nursing research and related fields. Includes construction of literature reviews for planning research projects and for research utilization. 

prereq: NURS 8142, instructor consent

subject: NURS
name: Topics in Nursing Research
fullname: Special Topics in Nursing Research
info:
Seminar and/or individual study of research design, methodologies, or instruments.

prereq: instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Problems in Nurs-Plan B
fullname: Problems in Nursing - Plan B
info:
Using a scholarly process to address a specific issue relevant to science/practice of nursing

prereq: [8100 or concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in  8100], [8170 or concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in  8170], instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Mixed Methods Research
fullname: Mixed Methods Research
info:
Synthesis of of qualitative and quantitative approaches in research designs. Evaluation of major mixed method designs and strategies for evaluating quality based on criteria. Data collection and analysis strategies for integrating quantitative and qualitative findings will be explored. 

prereq: NURS 8141

subject: NURS
name: Trns to Bcmng a Scntst of Nurs
fullname: Transition to Becoming a Scientist of Nursing
info: Emphasizes the transition to PhD study and begins the socialization process to the role of a scientist of nursing.

subject: NURS
name: Develop Fndtn Scntst of Nurs
fullname: Developing a Foundation as a Scientist of Nursing
info: Emphasizes the development of scholarly communication, and development and management of scientific resources.

subject: NURS
name: Exp Ldrshp & Team Skls Sc Nr
fullname: Expanding Leadership and Team Skills of the Scientist of Nursing
info: Emphasizes continued development of leadership skills with a focus on team science and interdisciplinary teams.

subject: NURS
name: Trns to Post-PhD Roles and Sch
fullname: Transition to Post-PhD Roles and Scholarship
info: Emphasizing transition and socialization processes to a professional post-PhD role.

subject: NURS
name: Planet Hlth CrssCut Nurs Rsrch
fullname: Planetary Health: Cross-Cutting Principles for Nursing Research
info: Ecosystem transformations due to human activity have a serious impact on global health. Students will analyze scientific evidence and discuss ethics about the effects of ecosystem changes on human health. Opportunities for nursing research and theory development to promote planetary health will be identified.

subject: NURS
name: Emrg Topcs Nurs Res & Hlth Sci
fullname: Emerging Topics in Nursing Research and Health Sciences
info: An exploration of emerging scientific topics in nursing and health care that have relevance to the evolution and development of research-based knowledge in nursing and the health sciences.

subject: NURS
name: Adv Pract Nurs:Roles & Issues
fullname: Advanced Practice Nursing: Roles and Issues
info:
Current most relevant professional/health care issues affecting diverse advanced practice nursing roles. Role theory, practice models, interdisciplinary team function, reimbursement, certification, scope of advanced nursing practice.

prereq: Admission to advanced practice area of study or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Health Leadership
fullname: Health Care Leadership for a Changing World
info:
Application of leadership theory/research to strengthen students. capacity to facilitate change in health care delivery system.

prereq: AHC grad student or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Population Focused Hlth Deliv
fullname: Population Focused Health Care Delivery Systems
info:
Health care organizations/delivery systems, their relation to health of diverse populations. Models of population focused care, use of research to improve health care delivery, effect of economic/social factors on health/health services.

prereq: Grad nurs student or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Dissertation Seminar
fullname: Dissertation Seminar
info:
This seminar is intended to support Nursing PhD students in the candidacy stage as they prepare and implement the dissertation proposal in collaboration with their dissertation committees. Students will participate in presenting and critically appraising parts of each other’s dissertation proposal plan or implementation as it develops. Students will seek and incorporate ongoing feedback from their advisor/committee in their discussion.

Prereq: PhD candidacy (passed preliminary written and oral exams)

subject: NURS
name: Cancer Principles
fullname: Cancer Principles and Practice
info: Synthesis of personal and societal risk factors in carcinogenesis. Analysis of strategies to prevent cancer and reduce morbidity. Models of acute, chronic, and late effects of treatment. Comparative analysis of ethical, legal, and socioculture issues in cancer care.

subject: NURS
name: Oncology Clinical I
fullname: Oncology Clinical I
info:
Synthesis and clinical application of knowledge of cancer risk factors and
advanced practice interventions to modify cancer risk behaviors of 			individuals, families, and communities. Use of research and clinical 			models to analyze, manage, and evaluate responses to cancer and treatment.

subject: NURS
name: Adv Pract Nurs Acute Hlth I
fullname: Advanced Practice Nursing for Acute Health Needs I
info: Evaluation of theories/models/research in symptom management. Application of therapy/research supporting clinical decision making with adults experiencing alterations in exchange, sensory, and mobility phenomena. Emphasizes client outcomes related to advanced practice nursing interventions.

subject: NURS
name: Res-based Clin Acute Care I
fullname: Research-based Clinical Reasoning and Management in Acute Care I
info: Synthesis/utilization of knowledge/research in care of adults with acute/critical illness. Advanced clinical decision making. Management of responses to acute cardiac, renal, and sensory alterations.

subject: NURS
name: Adv Pract Nurs Hlth Needs II
fullname: Advanced Practice Nursing for Acute Health Needs II
info: Evaluation of theories/models/research in management of acute symptoms.  Application of theory/research to support clinical decision making for adults experiencing alterations in metabolic, alimentary, and regulatory phenomena. Emphasizes client outcomes related to advanced practice nursing outcomes.

subject: NURS
name: Res-based Clin Acute Care II
fullname: Research-based Clinical Reasoning and Management in Acute Care II
info: Synthesis/utilization of knowledge/research in care of adults with acute/critical illness. Advanced clinical decision making. Management of responses to acute alterations in metabolic, alimentary, and pulmonary functions.

subject: NURS
name: Cancer & Acute Care
fullname: Psychological and Immunological Responses in Cancer and Acute Care
info:
Research-based evaluation and management of hematological and 		immunological responses to cancer and acute life-threatening illness. 
Exploration of theories and models used to explain and predict psychological adaptation in clients and their family members.

subject: NURS
name: Oncology Clin II
fullname: Oncology Clinical II
info: Synthesis of research and integration of knowledge in clinical management of complex physical and psychosocial care in cancer. Application of advanced practice and theoretical models to guide decision making and coping responses in clients and their families.

subject: NURS
name: Res-based Clin Acute Care III
fullname: Research-based Clinical Reasoning and Management in Acute Care III
info: Synthesis/utilization of knowledge/research in care of adults with acute/critical illness. Advanced clinical decision making. Management of responses to acute alterations in immunological, hematological, and psychological functions.

subject: NURS
name: Res Clin Reason&Mgmt Crit Care
fullname: Specialized Focus in Research-based Clinical Reasoning and Management in Acute Care
info:
Synthesis/utilization of knowledge/research in care of adults with acute/critical illness. Participation (in a clinical area of interest) in advanced decision making and in management of clients requiring restorative care.

prereq: 5200, 5222, 8100, 8140, 8170, 8240, 8303, 8305, 8309, advanced pharmacology, [pathophysiology or immunobiology]

subject: NURS
name: Chronic Health Conditions
fullname: Intervention Models for Adults/Elders with Chronic Health Conditions
info:
Development of theory-/research-based nursing intervention models for adults/elders with chronic health conditions. Students implement/evaluate intervention models in an advanced practice role with chronically ill adults/elders.

prereq: 5222, 5800, 8100, 8140, 8170, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Advanced Adult Nursing
fullname: Advanced Practice Nursing for Adults
info:
Development of clinical expertise in provision of advanced nursing care to adults with acute health problems needing restorative care. Students utilize theory/research to manage/evaluate acute health problems in a selected adult specialty area.

prereq: 5222, 5800, 8100, 8140, 8170, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: APN Roles with Adults
fullname: Implementing Advanced Practice Roles in Adult Nursing
info:
Clinical nurse specialist roles of case management, teaching, consultation, and collaboration. Students usw theory/research to provide advanced nursing care to adults within context of selected specialty area.

prereq: 5222, 5800, 8100, 8140, 8170, 8314, 8315

subject: NURS
name: Soc Perspect-Aging
fullname: Multidisciplinary Seminar on Social Perspectives of Aging
info: Literature/policy on key social aspects of aging, emphasizing service, policy, and ethical implications; generation of research questions.

subject: NURS
name: Care of Elderly I
fullname: Advanced Nursing Care of the Elderly I
info:
Functional patterns of health. Evaluation of theories/research as related to physiological, psychological, and sociological aspects of aging. Comprehensive assessment and research-based advanced nursing interventions to promote, maintain, and restore health of elderly.

prereq: Grad student in nursing, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Care for Elders
fullname: Primary Health Care for Elders
info:
Data-based primary care management of common acute/chronic conditions of elderly. Physiological, psychosocial, and pharmacological interventions. Age-related, cultural, family, and community variations. Implementation, evaluation of interventions.

prereq: 8321, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Care of Elderly II
fullname: Advanced Nursing Care of the Elderly (II): For Nurse Practitioners
info:
Synthesis and application of theory and research to effectively implement advanced gerontological nursing practice. Focuses on comprehensive primary care management across settings, evaluation of care, role analysis, and impact of contextual factors on health care services for the elderly.

prereq: 8322, 8xxx advanced gerontological nurs course, grad nurs major, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: GCNS: Adv Nurs Care Elder II
fullname: Advanced Nursing Care of the Elderly II: For Clinical Nurse Specialists
info:
Synthesis and application of theory and research to effectively implement as an advanced gerontological nurse. Comprehensive client care management across settings, evaluation of care, role implementation, and influences of contextual factors on health care services for the elderly.

prereq: Grad nurs major, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: FTE: Master's
fullname: FTE: Master's
info:
(No description)
Prereq Master's student, adviser and DGS consent.

subject: NURS
name: PMH:Adv Indiv & Fam
fullname: Advanced Practice Psychiatric/Mental Health Nursing with Individuals and Their Families
info:
Evaluation of theory and research; their application to advanced clinical management of biological, psychological, and social responses of individuals and families to psychiatric illness. Developing clinical expertise in assessment, diagnosis, treatment planning, and management of individuals and their families.

prereq: 5200, 5223, 5225, 8100, 8121, 8140, 8170

subject: NURS
name: Adv PMH: Grp & Comm
fullname: Advanced Practice Psychiatric/Mental Health Nursing in Groups and Community
info:
Application of theory and research to advanced practice psychiatric/mental health nursing with groups and community systems, including populations at risk. Clinical practicum provides experiences for developing advanced practice roles in variety of healthcare settings.

prereq: 5340, 8340, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in  8240, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in  8242

subject: NURS
name: Adv Clin Nursing
fullname: Advanced Clinical Nursing
info:
Independent study or faculty seminar on special clinical topic when interest exists.

prereq: Grad nurs major, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Special Topics in Nursing
fullname: Special Topics in Nursing
info: Students select and study a topic of interest.

subject: NURS
name: Prim Care:Advance Prac Nurses
fullname: Primary Care: Assessment and Management of Health for Advanced Practice Nurses
info:
Data-based assessment/management of preventive health services and common acute/chronic conditions of primary care populations. Emphasizes clinical reasoning and independent/collaborative practice health care plans.
Prereq-5200, 5222, 5224, 8242.

subject: NURS
name: Prim Care Prac:FNP Adv Prac N
fullname: Primary Care Practice for Family Nurse Practitioners: Assessment and Management of Health
info:
Application of advanced practice comprehensive health histories and physical assessments in formulating client centered databases. Development/implementation of care plans. Follow-up evaluation of primary care delivered to families across life span.

prereq: 5200, 5222, 8402

subject: NURS
name: Fam Pract Practicum I
fullname: Family Practice Practicum I
info:
Comprehensive advanced nursing assessment for acute/chronic health conditions of primary care population across life span. Synthesis/application of nursing theory/research in implementing/evaluating safe/effective nursing interventions to promote health and prevent illness.

prereq: 5200, 5222, 5224, 8402, 8601

subject: NURS
name: Fam Pract Practicum II
fullname: Family Practice Practicum II
info:
Synthesis of advanced practice nursing theory in data collection and in assessment of client in his/her environment. Implementation/evaluation of interventions for disease management in primary care setting. Nursing theory/research used in developing nursing practice models for health promotion, disease prevention, and intervention.

prereq: 5200, 5222, 5224, 8402, 8601

subject: NURS
name: Health Care Children FNP
fullname: Health Care of Children for the Family Nurse Practitioner
info:
Application of midrange theories, models, concepts applicable to promotion, maintenance, restoration of health of infants, children, adolescents within context of their families/communities. Current research evaluated/used for designing age-specific interventions for children and their families.

prereq: instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Health Care Children FNP Prac
fullname: Health Care of Children Practicum for the Family Nurse Practitioner
info:
Synthesis of research-based nursing assessment/intervention of minor acute/chronic health conditions in primary care population across life span. Application of nursing theory, research from related disciplines, in evaluating/implementing interventions. Clinical practicum in pediatric primary care. Focuses on assessment, primary health care, of well children from birth to adolescence.

prereq: 5200, 5222, 5224, 8242, 8402

subject: NURS
name: CB-CR Family Nurs
fullname: Childbearing-Childrearing Family Nursing
info: Maintenance, promotion, and restoration of health for clients in the childbearing-childrearing family. Theories and concepts related to parents, children, and families. Practicum includes conferences, written assignments, and use of grounded theory methods of investigation.

subject: NURS
name: FTE: Doctoral
fullname: FTE: Doctoral
info:
(No description)

prereq: Doctoral student, adviser and DGS consent

subject: NURS
name: PNP/FNP Well Child
fullname: Primary Care: Health Assessment and Care of Well Children
info:
Study of age-specific and family-centered assessment, prevention, and health promotion nursing interventions for infants through adolescents. Emphasis on theories and concepts related to comprehensive health supervision. Stresses the use of critical thinking for clinical decision making to implement and evaluate advanced practice nursing interventions.

prereq: 5200, 5222, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in  8451

subject: NURS
name: PNP/FNP Prac: Child
fullname: Primary Care Practicum: Health Assessment and Care of Well Children
info:
Focus on age-specific, family-centered nursing assessments/interventions to promote wellness of children, infants through adolescence. Emphasizes compiling/evaluating interventions for children/families. Practicum includes exposure to models of primary prevention.

prereq: 5200, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in  8450, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Acute Child
fullname: Primary Care: Common Acute Health Conditions Affecting Children
info:
Research-based evaluation and management of common acute conditions affecting children from infancy through adolescence. Exploration of theories and models used to explain and predict physiologic and psychologic adaptation of children and their families.
