prereq: 8501, 8451, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in  8453, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: PNP Acute/Chronic
fullname: Primary Care Practicum: Common Acute and Chronic Health Conditions Affecting Children
info:
Focus on age-specific, family-centered nursing assessment and intervention of minor acute and chronic conditions of children within family context. Emphasis on nursing intervention strategies include diagnostics, therapeutics, education, and follow-up evaluation of outcomes.

prereq: 8411, 8442, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in  8452, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Adv child/fam/comm
fullname: Primary Care Practicum: Synthesis of Advanced Nursing Practice for the Child, Family, Community
info: Research-based knowledge synthesis to effectively intervene with common pediatric physical and psychosocial alternations in health. Role implementation issues and development of an effective theory-based nursing practice model for care of individuals, families, and communities.

subject: NURS
name: Health Care Child
fullname: Health Care for Children and Youth with Special Health-Care Needs
info:
Primary care of children and youth with special healthcare needs, emphasizing growth and development, pathophysiology, specific conditions, and holistic, family-centered, community-based, culturally competent, and coordinated approach to assessment and intervention.

prereq: 8454

subject: NURS
name: Spec Hlth Care Need
fullname: Health Care for Children and Youth with Special Health Care Needs Practicum
info:
Research-based evaluation and management of psychologic and physiologic responses to chronic illness. Developing theory-based holistic, family-centered, community-based, culturally competent, coordinated nursing interventions. Clinical seminars incorporate advanced practice nursing models of care and interdisciplinary collaboration strategies.

prereq: 8454, 8455, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Spec Hlth Needs:Fam
fullname: Assessment and Intervention Models in Families of Children with Special Health Care Needs
info:
In-depth, systemic, and theory-based study of family health assessment methods and intervention models. Practicum to assess, intervene, and evaluate intervention models related to patterns of functioning in families of children with complex health-care needs.

prereq: 8124 or equiv, 8100, 8456, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Adv Nurs Child Acute Ill PCNS
fullname: Advanced Nursing Care of Children With Acute Illness for Pediatric Clinical Nurse Specialists
info:
Synthesis/application of theory/research to effectively implement pediatric clinical nurse specialist role. Focuses on comprehensive care management across settings, evaluation of care, role implementation, and contextual factors affecting health care for children with special health needs and families.

prereq: Nursing grad student admitted to pediatric clinical nurse specialist area of study or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Repro HC-Women Prac FNP
fullname: Reproductive Health Care for Women Practicum for the Family Nurse Practitioner
info:
Synthesis/utilization of nursing knowledge/research in clinical decision making process related to women's reproductive/sexual health throughout life cycle.  Evaluation of patient outcomes using nursing standards/criteria.

prereq: Concurrent registration with Nurs 8501, 8405

subject: NURS
name: Reproductive Health
fullname: Reproductive Health Care for Women
info:
Theory, current research underlying clinical practice in assessing/managing issues related to women's reproductive/sexual health throughout life cycle.

prereq: 5200, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Women at Risk
fullname: Reproductive Health Care for Women at Risk
info:
Theoretical and research basis for advanced practice nursing care of women and infants at risk for medical and/or psychosocial problems. Selected high-risk perinatal and complicated gynecological and neonatal conditions.

prereq: 8503 or 8520

subject: NURS
name: Childbearing Family
fullname: Nurse-Midwifery Care of the Childbearing Family
info:
Theoretical/research-based nurse-midwifery intrapartum care, management, support of women and their families. Labor, birth, immediate postpartum period, and newborn care. Development/implementation of nurse-midwifery care. Draws from research that provides basis for practice.

prereq: 8501, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: NMidw & Women's Hlth NP Prac
fullname: Nurse Midwifery and Women's Health Care Nurse Practitioner Primary Care Practicum
info:
Application of advanced practice comprehensive health histories and physical assessments in formulating client centered databases. Development/implementation of care plans. Follow-up evaluation of primary care delivered to adult populations. Focuses on women.

prereq: 5200, 5222, 8402

subject: NURS
name: Adv Women's Health
fullname: Advanced Concepts in Women's Health for the Nurse Practitioner
info:
Theoretical and research basis for women's healthcare nurse practitioner practice building on foundations of gynecological and antepartum care.  Preparation of childbearing family for birth and selected complex health concerns for women.

prereq: 8501, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Adv Public Hlth Nur
fullname: Advanced Public Health Nursing
info:
Conceptual frameworks for advanced public health nursing practice. Analysis of population-focused nursing research and of public health nursing management strategies.

prereq: Grad nursing major

subject: NURS
name: Interv Hlth Populat
fullname: Interventions for Health of Populations
info:
Synthesis of behavior formation/change, public health, and nursing models, theories, and research for critiquing and designing population-focused interventions. Developing, implementing, evaluating, and proposal writing for culturally competent public health interventions in community-based settings.

prereq: 8040

subject: NURS
name: PHN Int. Practicum
fullname: Public Health Nursing Intervention Practicum
info:
Applying principles, theory, and research about epidemiology/public health/public health nursing interventions to population-focused health issues.  Collaborating with community-based preceptors to achieve public health objectives.

prereq: 8242, 8601

subject: NURS
name: PHN Leadership Prac
fullname: Public Health Nursing Leadership Practicum
info:
Synthesis of leadership and advanced public health nursing theories and research; their applicability within public health nursing leadership situations.

prereq: 8100, 8170, 8241, 8242, 8600

subject: NURS
name: Doct Pre-Thesis Cr
fullname: Doctoral Pre-Thesis Credits
info:
tbd

prereq: Doctoral student who has not passed prelim oral; no required consent for 1st/2nd registrations, up to 12 combined cr; dept consent for 3rd/4th registrations, up to 24 combined cr; doctoral student admitted before summer 2007 may register up to four times, up to 60 combined cr

subject: NURS
name: Nrs/Hlth Admin I
fullname: Nursing and Health-Care Systems Administration I
info:
Intensive study of nursing and healthcare administration and leadership. Application of nursing, organization, care delivery, and population health improvement theories to health systems administrative practice. Planning, organizing care systems, assembling, and developing material and human resources.

prereq: instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Nrs/Hlth Car Adm II
fullname: Nursing and Health-Care Systems Administration II
info:
Intensive development of competencies associated with skilled administration of healthcare services. Application of organization, nursing, political, and economic theories in operationalizing and evaluating administrative and leadership practice of nurses in healthcare delivery systems.

prereq: 8701, instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Teaching Learn Process Nurs
fullname: Teaching Learning Process in Nursing
info: Critiquing theories of teaching/learning. Developing a theoretical/conceptual model for teaching. Testing models/methods in simulated situations.

subject: NURS
name: Nurse Educator
fullname: The Nurse Educator in Higher Education
info: Teaching practicum: comprehensive implementation/evaluation of effectiveness of personal teaching models in classroom/clinical settings in an academic environment. Roles/responsibilities of faculty. Issues affecting curriculum design/development.

subject: NURS
name: Thesis Credit:Mast*
fullname: Thesis Credits: Master's
info:
(No description)

prereq: Max 18 cr per semester or summer; 10 cr total required [Plan A only]

subject: NURS
name: Family Health Research Methods
fullname: Methods for the Study of Family Health Phenomena
info:
Exploration of conceptual and methodological approaches in study of family health phenomena from a nursing perspective. Formulation of research design to study questions in family health.

prereq: 8124, 8175 or equiv or instr consent

subject: NURS
name: Thesis Credit:Doct*
fullname: Thesis Credit: Doctoral
info:
(No description)

prereq: Max 18 cr per semester or summer; 24 cr required
